messages.subject: How to learn about unschooling (was Math phobia, again)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/03 7:00:39 AM, rubyprincesstsg@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/03 7:00:39 AM, rubyprincesstsg@... writes:

<< It's not that it doesn't make sense, its that many of the ideas seem
contradictory to ME. Then I ask about them, when I ask why this and not
this, no one really gives an answer, they get defensive and just say I don't
get it! >>

We're not being defensive. We are openly and repeatedly writing things we
have written before for YOUR benefit, we're responding to YOU, and you're not
being gracious or courteous or showing any appreciation for the gift you're
being given.

Here's how you can show that you really want to unschool.

Do not ever again, not even once say "I get it."
Not even when and if you eventually get it. (You haven't yet.)

Don't ever again, not even a little, tell us that asking questions is the way
to learn.
It only helps if you're being still and listening to the answers and then
going out and doing what the answers recommended that you do.

Sandra
